info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 15 at 3:03AM EDT until July 15 at 7:15AM EDT by NWS Mount Holly NJ
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of northern New Jersey, including the following counties, Middlesex, Morris and Somerset.
* WHEN...Until 715 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring across the warned area. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 301 AM EDT, local law enforcement reported continued road closures and flooding along Green Brook due to thunderstorms Monday evening. Flooding is already occurring. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... New Brunswick, Perth Amboy, Somerville, Somerset, Edison, East Brunswick, Sayreville, North Brunswick, Carteret, Madison, Middlesex and Florham Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around...don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 AM EDT THIS MORNING

area.areaDesc: Middlesex, NJ; Morris, NJ; Somerset, NJ
